result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel J Wallace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court
Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
The Defendant will not request early termination of probation
-------------------------------

miscConds.notes:
**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
----------------------------

Pay restitution if any is claimed.
-------------------------------

"No violent contact" with victims this includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. Possess no weapons. No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 
----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Obtain & maintain full-time employment and/or school. Obtain GED.
----------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed, as evidenced by receipt by this Court of a Certificate of Discharge from the probationary authority, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel J Wallace

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Samuel J Wallace in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Samuel J Wallace. Victim also present in court. Parties have a joint recommendation. Court adopts joint recommendation. Defendant pleads guilty to Count # 1. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Defendant does not make statement. Court gives warning to deportation. Minutes filed.

Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Samuel J Wallace in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Samuel J Wallace. 
Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Samuel J Wallace in court. Attorney Grace Hagerman for defendant. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH VICTIMS. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Samuel J Wallace in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Uzowulu appears specially. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
